title: Back-End Engineer
description:
For this key position, you must write solid code, understand complex systems, competently evaluate scalability trade-offs (eg, disk vs cpu vs memory), and quickly troubleshoot issues. You learn fast and are excited to dig into the latest technologies. Our stack includes Python, Erlang, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL, HBase, Hadoop, Redis and our own open-sourced solutions.
More than anything, you do your best work when you have lots of freedom and can take ownership of your projects from concept to finish.

title: Brand Sales Representative
description:
Drive AdRoll’s revenue growth through primarily phone-based consultative sales with a particular focus on selling retargeting
Make a high volume of outbound sales calls and emails to potential prospects
Educate prospects and develop solutions for their needs using AdRoll's advertising solutions
Close deals with a sense of urgency
Attend industry conferences to identify new prospects
Manage and upsell your clients over time
Take on increasing leadership opportunities within the sales team, from leading a vertical strategy to training new reps to crafting new sales material.
Synthesize user feedback for input into product development

title: Business Development Associate
description:
We are looking for a Business Development Associate to join our team.  The Business Development Associate will assist with the management and growth of existing strategic partnerships and will help to identify and source new business opportunities and strategic initiatives. Responsibilities include: 

• Manage day-to-day support of strategic technology and channel partners 
• Assist in all phases of business development process (proposal development, contract review, follow-up etc.) 
• Work though partner integrations from on-boarding to launch
• Manage high volume of accounts with channel partnerships in all verticals (local, retail, e-Commerce, travel, etc.)
• Analyze trends and maintain detailed reporting for BD partners
• Initiate new features and enhancements with our Product team
• Work closely with Development team to lead API integrations
• Field technical inquiries and support requests
• Lend a hand wherever needed

title: Director of Finance
description:
The Director of Finance will be responsible for oversight of all finance, accounting and reporting activities.  S/he will lead all day-to-day finance operations and oversee a team that has functional responsibility over accounting, accounts payable, accounts receivable and payroll.  The Director of Finance will ensure that AdRoll has the financial systems and processes in place to continue to scale the business.  

Responsibilities: 
Oversee all accounts, ledgers and reporting systems ensuring compliance with appropriate GAAP standards and regulatory requirements.
Maintain internal controls for receipt of revenue, costs, program budgets and actual expenditures.
Coordinate all audit activity.
Lead the annual budgeting and planning process; review all financial plans and compare to actual results with a view to identify, explain and correct variances as appropriate.
Consistently analyze financial data and present financial reports in an accurate and timely manner; clearly communicate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
You are a data driven marketer with broad interest and experience in online marketing channels and hands on experience with business-to-business email marketing. You will be joining our rapidly expanding marketing group as part of the growth marketing team. You love thinking about the big picture, but are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to do whatever needs to be done. This role will touch all aspects of the email and performance marketing roadmap including creation of campaign messaging and content, customer segmentation, lead nurturing and marketing automation, creative testing, and analytics.

Key Responsibilities 
Act as a business manager of email marketing, marketing automation and customer segmentation programs.
Manage and execute email distribution and marketing efforts via marketing automation platform including email creation, list segmentation and pre-deployment testing.
Develop and deliver comprehensive reports around marketing channels, initiatives and provide key insights to drive future changes and campaigns
Work with the rest of marketing and the product marketing team to develop relevant marketing communication, emails and landing page experiences.
Integrate strategies and recommendations into other marketing channels such as content marketing, social media and search marketing.
Become a 'product expert' in our industry, understand the hot issues and new developments in retargeting and display advertising
Become an internal product expert for marketing automation and customer segmentation

title: Front-End Engineer
description:
As a front-end engineer, you love building responsive, well-composed client side applications. You have a knack for putting yourself in the shoes of the user. You will spend your time between the client and the server, with the majority spent on the client. You know how to make things fast or feel snappy. You might be building out our application interfaces, updating the marketing website, and  working on our API.

You like to dig into the newest in development tech. Our stack consists of a very healthy dose of Python (Pylons/Pyramid) as app server, modern Javascript libraries on the front-end (jQuery, Backbone.js, Underscore, D3, SASS, CSS3, HTML5), git for source control and Erlang, Redis and PostgreSQL on the backend.


Object Oriented Javascript
jQuery
CSS3, SCSS (Sass)
HTML5
Clean & Organized Code
Knowledge or interest in learning Python
BS in computer science or related field or relevant work experience.
Has personal projects related to the web
Great attitude and good team player
Loves learning

title: Recruiter
description:
You love to connect with people, build great teams and are constantly thinking of new ways to attract the best talent and provide a great candidate experience. AdRoll is seeking a motivated, energetic recruiter who is positive, execution-oriented, and business results focused. His/her initial charter will be to partner closely with the Head of Staffing to drive all aspects of the staffing efforts for the company. 

Responsibilities


▪Manage the full cycle recruiting process for G&A roles, ensuring a smooth and positive candidate experience.
▪Develop, implement, and execute a streamlined hiring strategy.
▪Collaborate with internal clients to understand their hiring needs and goals.
▪Screen resumes and interview qualified candidates ensuring a smooth process through offer and candidate close.
▪Facilitate interview and hiring discussions with interviewers and hiring managers.
▪Drive offer process - including extending offers, partnering in closing candidates, and generating offer letters.
▪Act as an internally and externally-facing representative of AdRoll.

title: Brand Startegist, Creative Solutions
description:
Continually inspire our clients with a vision for their brand, game-changing ideas and plans to get them executed
Drive brand and business strategy discussions to uncover huge business needs and opportunities
Uncover social insights and develop Facebook solutions that drive the key business goals of our top clients
Partner with others on the team to make your and their ideas shine
Work with Product and Engineering to refine your ideas for maximum impact on the Facebook Platform
Be a thought leader on how social technology is fundamentally changing brand marketing

title: Business Analyst, Compensation
description:
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and help inform, influence, support, and execute our business decisions
Participate in the research for, and ongoing development and administration of a compensation program that matches Facebook’s needs
Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics and monitor the integrity and validity of the data reported
Obtain a thorough understanding of our data sources and collection methods
Develop compensation models and conduct statistical analysis
Analyze trends in compensation and build intelligence through reporting
Work with large amounts of data and build tools to streamline the process

title: Business Development
description:
Work with Facebook product and engineering teams to identify partnership opportunities
Represent Facebook in meetings with senior executives from other companies and own key relationships
Negotiate business and technical terms with strategic partners

title: Data Scientist
description:
Work closely with a product engineering team to identify and answer important product questions
Answer product questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data
Communicate findings to product managers and engineers
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
Analyze and interpret the results of product experiments
Develop best practices for instrumentation and experimentation and communicate those to product engineering teams

title: Global Policy Director
description: Facebook is looking for an experienced leader who can help us build and scale our Policy Management team. The team’s mission is to create and communicate guidelines for how our products should be used by Facebook users, advertisers, and developers. This involves developing and enforcing fair, thoughtful, and scalable content, marketing, and platform policies worldwide. As the Global Policy Director, you will lead a highly talented global team and collaborate with cross-functional teams on strategic initiatives. You will assume general management responsibilities and serve as a cross-functional liaison with Product, Engineering, Sales, Operations, Marketing, Corporate Communications and Legal among others. You should feel comfortable operating in a fast paced environment and driving change, and be passionate about general management and leading cross-functional decision-making processes. This role is located at our headquarters in Menlo Park, California.

title: Growth Marketing Analyst
description:
Leverage data to understand our products in depth, identify areas of opportunity, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement of Facebook users
Drive projects focusing on new user growth, mobile usage, and revenue - working closely with design, product, engineering, and data teams
Work both on core Facebook products like news feed, notifications, and mobile, and offsite marketing channels like SEO, SEM, and email
Use tools like Hadoop/Hive, Oracle, ETL, R, PHP, Python, Excel, MicroStrategy, and many other internal tools to work efficiently at scale
skills: Math, stats, comp-sci, SQL, scripting, data analysis, project management, communication skills, marketing, software developement

title: Product Designer
description:
Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and valuable for our billion+ users
Design flows and experiences that are incredibly simple and elegant
Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product and executive teams
Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality
Partner with PMs, engineers, researchers and content strategists to oversee the user experience of a product from conception until launch (and then some)
skills: Communication, front-end programming, product startegy, portfolio of work, interaction design

title: Software Engineer, Mobile iOS
description:
Work closely with our product and design teams to customize the Facebook experience for the iOS platform
Implement custom native user interfaces using the latest iOS programming techniques
Build reusable iOS software components for interfacing with the Facebook platform
Analyze and optimize UI and back-end application code for efficiency and performance
skills: object-oriented software, objective-c, C++, Cocoa, APIs, multithreading programming, unit tests, and testable code, iOS SDK performance tools, problem solving, critical thinking, communication

title: Software Engineer, Payments
description:
Design and build core parts of the Facebook Payments Platform
Code primarily in C++ and PHP
Conduct code audits and design reviews
Interface with other teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa
Build new products that will enable new revenue streams and opportunities for Facebook.
skills: developing systems, payments, e-commerce, proactive, software development experience, portfolio

title: UX Researcher
description:
Work closely with product teams to identify research topics
Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes
Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs
Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods and a subset of quantitative methods, such as surveys
Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways
skills: Verbal  communication, visual communication, quantitive analysis, behavioral analysis, applied product research,

title: Front-End Engineer
description:
The front-end engineer will help us push the boundaries of what is possible. You’ll work side by side with outstanding designers. You should be proficient in HTML, CSS and Javascript. You should appreciate the details that make a front-end user experience memorable, and demonstrate enthusiasm for new front-end technologies.

A few other things we look for:

Execution: A portfolio of products you have shipped.

Attention to Detail: An appreciation for high-quality execution.

Ambition: A desire to improve yourself as an engineer.

Culture: Broad personal interests beyond software.

Personality: Enthusiasm for working collaboratively with talented people.

Marksmanship: Excellence in NERF dart-throwing a plus.

title: iOS Software Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a talented iOS Engineer to help build an application that transforms how millions of people discover and collect inspiration everyday. You should have experience building beautiful high-performance applications on mobile and be able to work full-time.

Responsibilities:

Contribute and implement new features from scratch
Writing clean, maintainable code while rapidly iterating and shipping
Work with our world class creative team to craft and execute pixel perfect designs
Improving the stability and performance of the iOS app by profiling and analyzing crash logs
Apply your knowledge of software engineering fundamentals to constantly evolving real-world challenges on a daily basis

title: Product Manager
description:
Help define and execute our strategy for products
Help define, build and launch new products and features
Analyze what pinners need, and help us understand it
Help us decide which projects are most critical

title: Business Analytics Manager
description:
We’re looking for a Business Analytics Manager to join our Finance team to help us understand and improve our business practices. You’ll dive deep into big datasets, noting the drivers and relationships that affect our key metrics. You’ll analyze this data to help us prioritize projects and grow our business.

Responsibilities:

Own Pinterest’s operating model
Build and own Pinterest’s organizational systems for tracking and forecasting key metrics
Leverage data to guide decisions and refine your analysis as you learn new things
Identify and prioritize the company’s biggest challenges
Work with our product and engineering teams to set priorities, diagnose issues and measure success
Work with our user research and data science team to tie quantitative and qualitative research together
Synthesize and communicate your insights in presentations and metrics dashboards
Recruit a great team to grow our business analytics team

title: Community Operations Manager
description:
We’re looking for a talented leader to define and build our community operations program. You’ll support pinners across the world, identify bugs in our product, give important feedback to other teams, and help every pinner have a great experience. You’ll report to the Head of Community Operations on the community team.

Responsibilities:

Set our team’s strategy and vision
Recruit, lead and grow a team of community specialists
Develop a strategy for supporting pinners worldwide
Work with product, creative and engineering team to improve our product experience
Build customer or user operations at a large scale
Coordinate with writers, marketers and the PR team to communicate with pinners

title: Head of Corporate Development
description:
We’re looking for a Head of Corporate Development to help us execute acquisitions that will accelerate Pinterest’s growth, both internally as a team and product and externally with users and partners. In this role, you’ll develop relationships with investors, founders, and others in the tech community to build a pipeline of acquisition candidates. You’ll work closely with Recruiting, Engineering, Design, and Product to set priorities and evaluate talent, technology, and products. You’ll work closely with Legal and Finance to negotiate, structure, and close transactions.

The ideal Head of Corporate Development will be:

Experienced at building and scaling streamlined cross-functional processes
A great external representative of Pinterest who can proactively build relationships with entrepreneurs
Extremely efficient and structured - able to get lots done with limited resources
Responsibilities:

Build a pipeline of acquisition candidates across a variety of channels: investors, internal referrals, outreach
Identify and build relationships with acquisition candidates that fit Pinterest’s strategy and needs
Hone the acquisition process, collaborating with engineering, recruiting, legal, and finance
Negotiate, close, integrate, and measure the success of acquisitions
Recruit a world-class team to help grow this function into one of the key drivers of Pinterest’s business

title: Product Designer
description:
As a Product Designer, you will be responsible for defining how people interact with Pinterest. We’re looking for designers passionate about social product design - not just how Pinterest looks (although that counts too), but how people use Pinterest to connect with each other. Our product designers sit with engineers at the beginning of every new project. We care about how every little bit of an interaction feels, and you need to as well.

Communication

You should be able to clearly articulate your design decisions
Execution

Portfolio of design projects demonstrating outstanding product design skill
Self-Sufficiency

The ability to implement what you design (javascript, css, html)
Social

Passion for social web applications and social design
Mobile

Experience with mobile design is a plus
Learning

Desire to better yourself as a product designer

title: Quantitative User Experience Researcher
description:
We’re looking for a Quantitative Researcher to help us reveal deep and actionable insights about the millions of people who use Pinterest. You should be a career researcher who can design, execute and communicate strategic research on a deadline. Bonus points if you’ve researched mobile and international growth in discovery, social or graph-based products before. You’ll report to the research manager and be a member of the Pinterest Creative team.

We’re looking for someone who:

Designs research that’s creative
Is a talented methodologist who can make data actionable for product teams
Says “yes and “ and is excited to try new things
Is a radical collaborator
Cares most about shipping products and helping people have great experiences
Responsibilities:

Help define quantitative user experience research at Pinterest
Develop a capacity to deploy surveys that help us understand how pinners use and feel about our products
Do research that varies in approach, scale, scope, timeframe and research methodologies
Collaborate with a variety of project teams at Pinterest
Proactively communicate and share your research findings with team members, the Pinterest community and other audiences
Lead research projects that range from evaluative to formative

title: Business Operations, Manager
description:
Twitter is seeking a creative, data-driven Manager to join our Business Operations team.  The Business Operations team reports to our COO, and partners closely with him to carry out strategic and operational priorities.  The role, specifically, will be partnering with our Media, Business Development (Biz Dev) and Business Intelligence (BI) teams.  Managers will be responsible for leading a diverse set of projects and tracking success around some of our largest initiatives.  Successful candidates can structure ambiguous problems, possess deep analytical capabilities, and have demonstrated the ability to lead the implementation of key projects.  Additionally, they are fast learners, offer a balanced perspective, work collaboratively, and feel comfortable presenting to executives. 
  
Responsibilities: 
As a key member of our team, you will work closely with partners around Twitter.  As such, you will: 
 
Build relationships with leaders on our global Media, Biz Dev and BI teams to carry out cross-functional, priority projects
Model estimated impact, build dashboards to track success, and synthesize insights around our strategic partnerships
Interface with our BI team to ensure their insights are well understood and implemented by our Biz Dev and Media teams
Partner with the Financial Planning team to determine budgets and resourcing for initiatives
Lead or independently manage projects hand-selected by Twitter’s executive leadership team
Communicate your plans and actions fearlessly and effectively across Twitter
Be personable, approachable and able to connect with the team and throughout the business

title: Data Scientist
description:
As a Twitter Data Scientist, you will be designing, building, and shipping complex models that learn from Twitter data. We are looking for folks that are passionate about understanding data, are well versed in scalable data mining and machine learning techniques, and love to build models. If challenges like the Netflix prize and KDD cup excite you, this is your dream job. A passion for measuring model quality and iteratively improving them using feature engineering is a big plus.
Responsibilities
Apply data-mining, machine learning and/or graph analysis techniques for a variety of modeling and relevance problems involving users, their relationships, their tweets and their interests
Build complex statistical models that learn from and scale to petabytes of data
Use Map-Reduce frameworks such as Pig and Scalding, statistical software such as R, and scripting languages like Python and Ruby
Write and interpret complex SQL queries for standard as well as ad hoc data mining purposes
Define metrics, understand A/B testing and statistical measurement of model quality
Understand and leverage crowdsourcing and human computation approaches to data labeling

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Engineering managers at Twitter provide the leadership needed to build technologies that flawlessly serve the billion tweets our users submit on a weekly basis.  As Twitter evolves, we need managers to lead the engineering teams that make the world’s largest real-time system scalable and efficient.  The following describes what we think are the paths to success for this role:  
  
We believe passion and personality matter.   As such, we need someone who can manage diverse, smart, and driven engineers while balancing personnel challenges with business requirements.  A successful engineering manager will:
Mentor the professional development of each direct report through personal and performance management.
Be an aggressive source of engineering talent and be comfortable closing candidates
Give engineers the tools, confidence, and motivation to make decisions independently that lead to the recognition of your engineers and not just yourself.

title: Experience Designer, Activation & Messaging
description:
As a designer on the A&M team, you will work with product management and engineering throughout all stages of the product cycle. You strive to synthesize all forms of input in coming up with simple, coherent design solutions, and articulate and defend our decisions to the whole team. You are passionate about Twitter and are a champion of every person who uses our product, solving the complex design issues of a real-time communication and information network.
This role is based in San Francisco, CA. 
Responsibilities
Work with product management to collect requirements, articulate user needs, and develop strategies to address those needs
Work with product management and engineering to develop potential solutions and convey those solutions via storyboard/prototype
Partner with Design Research and Analytics to inform and improve design recommendations and understand what constitutes a successful design for a given problem
Collaborate with other designers where overlap between product areas and features occur
Develop and maintain design wireframes, mockups, and specifications as needed
Create and advance site-wide style guides

title: Software Engineer - Mobile Analytics
description:
More and more people today use Twitter on mobile devices. To deliver the best experience for our users, we make product decisions based on data. What features lead to greater retention? What are the differences between Twitter for Android and Twitter for iPhone users?  As a mobile analytics software engineer, you will work on analysis tools and infrastructure to help answer such questions. You will work on the full analytics stack, including defining new logging in mobile clients, processing raw logs data, and visualization and reporting of results.
 
Responsibilities
- Write code in Java, Scala, and Pig to process logs data.
- Write code in Ruby and Javascript to visualize data.
- Build tools to simplify and automate mobile data analysis.
- Work with product managers, data scientists, and data analysts to understand analysis requirements.
- Work with mobile client engineers to understand the data we collect and define new logging.

title: Technical Recruiter
description: As a recruiter with Twitter, you will partner with some of the industry's premier engineering and business leaders.  Our hiring managers rely on the recruiters to consult deeply on all matters of hiring strategies, org dev, and offer negations.  As a member of the Twitter recruiting team, you will have support network of one of the most experienced (and simply fun) recruiting groups in the entire interwebs business.

title: Video Editor/Producer
description:
What we’re looking for 
Your approach to narrative equally delights and informs. You have an organized mind that bursts with creativity and possess a relentless hunger to create the best possible work. You are a team player, but have the skills to take a video from start to finish on your own if required. Basically, you are a super awesome and passionate video maker. So are we. Let's rock this together! 

Responsibilities
Produce, film, and edit videos and motion graphics to support video team needs, including product education (how Twitter works, how ad products function) and marketer education (best practices, case studies, client testimonials, research and insight)
Organize the production scheduling, location prep, equipment resourcing, and talent management of video shoots
Design and implement an asset management system (video clips, project files, other assets)
Brainstorm and collaborate with members of the video team to create a consistent story and video catalog
Event video production

title: Marketing Designer
description:
As a subset of Design, Marketing Design works with teams across the company to reach millions of people around the world, spreading awareness, understanding, and appreciation of Twitter’s value. As a member of this team, you’ll create and produce messaging material to further spread the value and global impact of the service. You know how to tell masterful stories with your designs and creations. You’re comfortable working across multiple design disciplines and media, including mobile and web design, print, presentation, and signage. You can do the production or prototyping work to implement your own designs. You align your creative efforts with existing brand strategy, and know how to appropriately extend the brand with simple and cleverly designed messaging. You are passionate about Twitter and are constantly thinking of ways its value can be communicated and spread worldwide. 
  
What we’re looking for 
Your work is clean, modern, focused, and inspiring to others. You have experience working across interaction, visual, and graphic design, and have an interest in motion design and data visualization. You have a passion for understanding and solving problems for people, and communicating in a way that delivers a clear and concise message. 

Responsibilities
Work across Marketing, Communications, Sales, and Business Development teams to create, maintain, and improve the methods and systems we use to promote Twitter
Ensure quality and consistency of Twitter’s visual brand language
Augment and maintain brand guidelines for internal and external use
Design cohesive sets of slides, templates, and visuals for presentations
Create title sequences, animations, and assets for Twitter marketing videos
Use data to your advantage in crafting elegant and intuitive visualizations
Design microsites & blog templates and extend an existing CMS

title: Design Lead, Mainstream
description:
A designer who has experience leading and managing other designers and leading projects. You have strong communication and project management skills, and are confident presenting work to leadership in the company. Your work is clean, modern, focused, and inspiring to others. You have worked across interaction, UI and graphic design, and have an interest in motion design. You are passionate about design, telling product stories, and solving problems for people.  
Responsibilities
Lead a small team of designers on focused product experience areas (i.e. Search & Discover)
Manage and mentor 2-3 designers that are on your team
Partner with Design Research to inform and improve design recommendations
Communicate scenarios, end-to-end experiences, interaction models, systems, and screen designs to project stakeholders and company leadership
Work with product managers to set requirements and translate them into concepts and elegant interface designs
Work with our visual designers to incorporate the visual identity of Twitter into features
Collaborate with engineering to help build prototypes, and implement final products to spec

title: Sales Manager, Mid-Market
description:
Twitter is creating a world-class team of sales professionals, and is seeking leading Sales Managers to develop our teams. 
  
If you are an enthusiastic Twitter user with relevant sales experience, a strong track record, and solid customer relationships, we invite you to talk to us about advertising sales management opportunities at Twitter, Inc. 
  
 We are looking for someone to: 
 
Grow our business in a way that makes us proud by developing the people on your team and leading them through motivation and inspiration.
Recognize that passion and personality matter when recruiting, developing and managing your teams as well as working with your clients.
Be rigorous by using supportive data to help inform key management decisions as well as key client solutions.

title: Engineer
description:
Our product is built primarily in Ruby and JavaScript/CoffeeScript. Problems we work on include:

Infrastructure
Infrastructure encompasses everything below the application layer. Most of the work here is building software that enables the API and web interface. Examples include finding and removing performance bottlenecks, building a framework for stream processing, and server architecture and administration.

Data analytics and fraud detection
Stripe has a lot of data problems to tackle, ranging from fraud algorithms to understanding how people are using Stripe. Our data sources include everything from a user clicking around the Stripe web interface to a consumer making a purchase on that user's website, and we're always building better ways of discovering signals in the seeming chaos.

Applications
Our major external-facing applications are the Stripe web interface and the API. We move quickly, deploying code many times a day. We iterate rapidly, but we also spend time carefully thinking through the edge cases of our products and making sure that they work very well.

title: Designer
description:
We're looking for designers who can make detailed graphics, but also have a deep understanding of how applications should work and — more importantly — how they should feel.

You should be able to implement your ideas into working prototypes using HTML and CSS. The projects you'll be working on include everything from creating simple and intuitive user interfaces to more traditional web design.

As a designer you'll be working closely with engineers to develop new features and enhance current parts of Stripe. You'll have creative control over your projects and help set the visual tone of Stripe.

Requirements

Experience creating and maintaining products with real-world users.
Comfortable working in HTML and CSS.
Strong and opinionated visual design.
Pluses:

Icon or illustration work.
Great understanding of CSS, especially its issues and quirks.
Comfortable in JavaScript or CoffeeScript.

title: Office Manager
description:
Everyone at Stripe cares about making it a great place to work. Stripe is composed of smart, funny, hardworking people, and we found a beautiful, laid-back workspace in the Mission to call home. Our Office Manager will be responsible for helping this team stay happy and productive, and will shape our workspace culture.

If you're the kind of person who cares about employee happiness and if you're ready to make a difference across the company, this is the job for you.

You'll be responsible for:

Creating a beautiful and productive office environment.
Performing reception duties: welcoming guests, managing vendors.
Keeping the office fully stocked with everything from computers to Sharpies.
Supervising our various contractors, from janitors to plant maintenance.
Managing new hire onboarding.
Organizing events ranging from hackathons to employee trips.
Handling Stripe swag: picking items to stock and shipping them to Stripe users.
Dealing with office emergencies, like when the AC breaks on the hottest day of the year.

title: Reliability Engineer
description:
Reliability engineers make Stripe work. Whether it's deploying and maintaining server clusters, building tools to automate a deployment pipeline, or designing and implementing a new piece of our request pipeline, reliabliity engineers make sure that Stripe is as fast and reliable as possible.

Sample Projects

Design and build tools for managing our server fleet.
Build a profiling framework in our code, and fix performance bottlenecks.
Identify and eliminate the most likely reasons for Stripe to go down.
Improve our Puppet abstractions so it's easy for others to deploy their own services.
You might be a fit if...

You have extensive experience writing production code, though you lean more towards playing around with running systems.
You desire to automate all the things, but you have the pragmatism to decide when and how to introduce automation.
You're comfortable with Bash as a tool for solving one-off problems, but you switch to a language like Ruby or Python for general solutions.

title: Account Executive
description:
As our first Account Executive at Stripe, you will close deals and play an integral role in defining our sales strategy. You're an energetic and organized self-starter; you understand the sales process, can build relationships with the right decision-makers, and can succinctly define and communicate the specific benefits of Stripe appropriate for each user. You will be a key driver of revenue growth for the company, and on the front lines for evangelizing our product to prospective and existing users.

If you're hungry, smart, persistent, and a great teammate, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities

Turn inbound leads into happy Stripe users.
Work with the growth team to design and execute sales campaigns.
Build and manage a sales pipeline.
Make every potential Stripe user happy with every interaction, regardless of deal size.
Build and enhance relationships with our largest users.
Create sales materials and demos to effectively showcase Stripe.

title: Support
description:
As part of this role, you'll work with the outside world to help more businesses use Stripe. You'll work with developers, business owners, product managers, and finance and accounting staff. Payments problems can be complex with many stakeholders, and it will be your job to make sure everyone understands why Stripe makes sense.

You'll get a chance to share Stripe's tech culture in the wider community. We host events, attend conferences, sit down for coffee, blog, and hang out in IRC. We try to write software worth talking about, and then talk about it.

You may like this job if:

You love to teach, and meet new people.
You can't stand any user having a bad experience.
You have a keen sense for seeing through the question being asked to the actual problem a user is having.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Infrastructure engineers build the platform used by the rest of Stripe. Sometimes this involves building highly-available distributed systems. Sometimes this requires creating internal tools to improve our development workflow. Sometimes this involves staring at a backtrace trying to track down an obscure interaction between two system components.

Sample projects

Design and implement a durable complex event-processing service with exactly-once semantics.
Create an internal framework for writing new API endpoints.
Track down and fix a memory leak plaguing a service.
You might be a fit if...

You've designed widely-used libraries.
You've scaled a large system before. You realize that 95% of scaling is doing nitty-gritty detail work.
You have extensive experience with server operations, though you lean more towards writing code.

title: Launch Marketing Team
description: We’re on a mission to build an incredible sense of community through transportation, and we're looking for talented Launchers to spread the Lyft love by sparking new communities across the world.  If you are a natural influencer, love meeting new people, enjoy traveling, and possess an outgoing and uplifting personality, we'd love to meet you.

title: Community Manager
description:
Lyft is hiring a creative social media guru to join our Community Engagement team! You will stoke the fires of Lyft’s tight-knit community on a daily basis, building meaningful online relationships with drivers and passengers. You live and breathe social beyond the 9-5 and understand how to build buzz, cultivate loyal users, and activate evangelists for a global brand.

You are the voice of Lyft on social. You monitor Lyft’s public presences on social media and moderate our active driver forums. You craft original, engaging content in high volume and publish it on an optimized schedule for maximum engagement. You are also a strategic thinker who understands the anatomy of effective tactics across different social media channels. You are open, responsive, and empathetic. You report to the Director of Community Engagement.

title: Graphic Designer
description: Lyft is hiring a graphic designer! Join our creative team and boost Lyft to new artistic heights. You will power the illustrated world of Lyft, conceptualizing and creating unique graphics for use in emails, social media campaigns, event invitations, and promotions. You understand how to create artwork that tells a story, whether you’re illustrating the famous Disco Lyft (!) or communicating a new operational change that affects drivers. You report to the VP Community.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The LinkedIn Product team sets strategy, owns their numbers, and builds innovative products that professionals don't just use, but love. They thrive on data and on the opportunity to push the boundaries of web products- all in the pursuit of continued success as the world's largest professional network.
With Slideshare being the latest acquisition by Linkedin, you get the best of both worlds - fun aspects of working in a small office, and the benefits of a large, public company. Slideshare is growing fast (60 million visitors/month). 
Desired Skills & Experience
For every software engineering role, you should have a solid foundation in computer science with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design. Ideally, you have experience and desire to work in a short-cycle, agile, iterative development team.

title: Full Life Cycle Recruiter
description:
LinkedIn's Talent organization encompasses Human Resources, Recruiting, and Security. This team is dedicated to creating a rewarding workplace culture that attracts first-class talent, promotes excellence, and provides ample opportunities to transform each employee's career trajectory. They've perfected the art of maintaining a collaborative, congenial atmosphere while working hard.
LinkedIn is looking for an exceptional full life cycle recruiter to join our product recruiting team. You will be responsible for identifying, attracting, screening, and closing qualified candidates in the truest sence of full life cycle. Our recruiters are both sourcers and recruiters utilizing all their skills to attract and close candidates, and to build a true partnership with hiring managers and their teams.

title: Data Scientist
description:
As a Senior Data Scientist at LinkedIn, you will develop innovative new technologies, features, and products that help connect the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful. 

Our team applies machine learning techniques on social data to build products & features that reach over 200M professionals on LinkedIn. We build graph and text mining systems to tackle hard problems in areas like entity resolution, search relevance, recommendation algorithms, reputation & skills assessment, and network analysis. 
Along with our team of data scientists, you’ll work with product managers, designers, and engineers to build data driven features and products like LinkedIn Skills, Endorsements, and InMaps.
If you enjoy working with data to build products and solve hard problems in creative ways, you will fit right in.

title: Front-End Engineer
description:
The LinkedIn Product team sets strategy, owns their numbers, and builds innovative products that professionals don't just use, but love. They thrive on data and on the opportunity to push the boundaries of web products- all in the pursuit of continued success as the world's largest professional network.
We’re looking for smart people to join our small team who can get thingsdone! We ship fast and frequently; our engineers enjoy the exposure to our full technical stack.

Desired Skills & Experience

Someone with experience building web products using JavaScript, HTML, CSS and at least one server-side scripting language (Ruby, Python, PHP, etc). Linux experience and/or MySQL experience is a plus.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
GoodData is seeking a product marketer who shares our passion for connecting business people with the data they need to make better business decisions. GoodData is a horizontal platform for business analytics - we deliver operational dashboards and advanced analytics to line-of-business leaders across the front-office: sales, marketing, support, operations, etc. GoodData helps companies measure a single aspect of the business with our pre-built analytics apps, and as adoption grows and data sources are added, companies measure complete business processes like lead-to-cash in GoodData.
 
We are seeking a product marketing leader to document and increase our domain expertise in business analytics across multiple use cases and vertical markets. The right candidate understands the importance of data and analytics today, and can lead GoodData's effort to educate businesses to the best ways to measure their business.

title: Sales Director
description:
Develop a territory strategy to penetrate vertical markets while leveraging multiple team resources, including inside sales, field sales, sales engineers, professional services, marketing and customer support.
Communicating a value proposition to Fortune 1000 marketing executives by gaining both credibility and trust in the feature set of GoodData.
Manage complex sales cycles with multiple stake-holders.
Succeed in a team selling environment, partnering with inside sales and sales engineers for maximum territory and client coverage.
Consistently forecast monthly and quarterly performance within a 10% margin of error from actual bookings.
Develop and leverage partner relationships and alliances.
Stay abreast of industry changes and trends.

title: Solutions Architect - Implementation Services
description:
As a key member of our Consulting team, you will be the technical lead that helps guide our customers through their implementation.  Working directly with customers to understand requirements, you will design and configure logical data models, ETLs, dashboards, and knowledge sharing to customer resources.
The right candidate for this position is customer oriented with strong communication and technical skills. You must be able to demonstrate deep technical skills and clearly articulate technical topics to non-technical audiences. 
This role is best suited for someone who has 2+ years of work experience, has a quantitatively-oriented degree (of any variety) from a top-tier school, and who thrives in extremely analytical, technically-oriented, consultative role.

title: Associate General Counsel, Product
description:
Airbnb (www.airbnb.com) is seeking a highly qualified Associate General Counsel, Product.  This attorney will work closely with Airbnb’s business leaders around the world and report to Airbnb’s General Counsel in support of our global business efforts.  Responsibilities will include product counseling and regulatory reviews and advice in multiple jurisdictions, including data, privacy, and marketing issues.  You will meet regularly with the business and product leaders and serve as the primary legal contact for several internal clients. 

Candidates should be execution oriented, have strong business acumen, and have superior analytical and writing skills.  Additionally, excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with colleagues in multiple geographies and functions are essential to succeed in this role.  Creative problem solving is a must.

title: Interaction Designer
description:
Airbnb's interaction designers make the complex simple and know the details aren't the details, they are the product. Do you love to choreograph the dance of getting users from A to B? Are your instincts in touch with a higher power known as 'usability'? Well then you get that the best interactions aren't even noticed by a user because the design gets out of their way. We seek someone who loves getting in the weeds to smooth out existing interactions and invent new ones. Your work will ensure that guests and hosts all around the world will be able to use Airbnb.

Online portfolio required to apply.

title: Software Engineer, iOS
description:
We’re looking for product-aware engineers who are thoughtful, responsible and passionate builders who appreciate user experience. We’re looking for someone who is not only well versed in iOS development, but also has a strong understanding of good UX and isn’t afraid to get their hands dirty in backend code. We believe that great product people use lots of products, so if you’re an active user of Airbnb, we are listening.

 

Why is iOS important at Airbnb?

 

Not only is mobile quickly becoming the preferred means to book travel, but mobile uniquely enables our hosts to be responsive and connects our guests to their surroundings. Because of the unique form-factor of mobile, we put a particular emphasis on the user-experience design. Our apps have been featured in the app store and at WWDC.

 

What are examples of work that iOS engineers have done at Airbnb?

 

We built a calendar management tool because keeping our systems synced with the ever-changing schedules of our hosts is critical.
We’ve internationalized the app into 18 languages.
Increasingly we are building functionality that only exists on mobile. Although there are a number of such things in flight, at the time of writing this, they hadn’t yet been shared publicly :-)

title: Software Engineer, Full Stack
description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Airbnb?

There is much more that we want to build and so much that we could improve. We value strong engineers who are agile enough to jump into most projects.

The following are some examples of profiles that are relevant to us:

Ruby-on-Rails in production environments 
Strong Java experience
Exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale web application
Exceptional proficiency using HTML/CSS/Javascript/AJAX
Demonstrated design and UX sensibilities
Rigor in A/B testing, test coverage, and other web best practices

title: Payroll Manager
description:
We’re looking for a Payroll Manager who enjoys taking on new challenges and is looking for a role that will continually evolve and expand as the company grows.

The ideal candidate for this position will have excellent organization, prioritization and communication skills.  A strong attention to detail, the ability to meet deadlines consistently and to work well under pressure is a must. The successful candidate will help create and setup processes that maintain and/or improve the daily operations within the Payroll/Accounting/Finance Department.

The position reports to the Senior Accounting Manager with key responsibilities to include:

Accurate and timely processing of multi-state bi-weekly domestic payroll
Verify payroll input, including time reported by non-exempt employees, and the output for completeness and accuracy
Responsible for special payroll tax calculations and withholdings including garnishments
Update/maintain payroll worksheet, verify hours and approvals; transfer data to payroll system
Complete month end close including preparation of payroll journal entries
Assist in developing and managing processes and policies
Assisting with various ad hoc projects

title: Technical Sourcer
description:
Airbnb is revolutionizing the way the world travels. Tagged by Time Magazine as the "eBay of Space", Airbnb is a profitable, fast-growing, online marketplace giving everyday people the ability to monetize their most valuable asset: an extra bedroom, vacation rental, airbed, castle, boat, tree house or trailer. With a presence in over 9000 cities in 160 countries Airbnb is backed by Sequoia Capital and Greylock and is one of their most exciting start-ups.
 
We are looking for a technical sourcer to help build our engineering team here at Airbnb.

Responsibilities include:
- supporting the recruiting team by building a pipeline of top engineers through researching and sourcing for candidates
- contacting and engaging candidates
- qualifying candidates for technical and cultural fit
- staying abreast of news in the tech startup space
- represent the company with integrity and professionalism

title: User Experience Designer
description:
Design for Web and Mobile Applications

Maintain a user-centered approach in your design perspective and practice.
Work as an effective and communicative team member with clients, developers, and fellow designers.
Help product managers assess and prioritize opportunities and constraints.
Guide product decisions through user research, customer development, and iterative feedback loops.
Determine best practice approaches and lead the client through our process.
Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications.
Conduct user testing interviews and analysis.
Produce deliverables for clients and developers, including user flows, wireframes, mockups, live style guides, and assets.
Effectively prioritize work based on deadlines and input from clients and developers.

title: Accounting Manager
description: Pivotal Labs is experiencing new levels of growth and we are looking for a motivated, hands-on Accounting Manager to oversee the day to day accounting activities.  This individual will be responsible for all accounting functions, including the month end close, software and services invoicing and revenue recognition, vendor payments, working with International subsidiaries, maintaining financial controls and special projects.  The Accounting Manager will manage a team of direct reports, while being very hands-on in accounting.

title: Product Manager
description:
As a recognized leader in highly disciplined agile software development practices, Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.

In addition to our software development and UX design practices, Pivotal Labs now offers Product Management services to our clients. We serve as interim product managers for clients who are looking to build successful products quickly. We work closely with founders, entrepreneurs, designers, engineers, and customers to ensure the right product is defined, prioritized, and built.

title: Software Engineer
description: We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We practice and teach an approach to software engineering that applies across industries and organizations, so you’ll experience all types of teams, products, and technologies. And we believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.

title: Print and Packaging Design
description: Our graphic design is as elegant and functional as our hardware. From packaging to product guides, we help define how Square is understood in physical form.

title: Copywriting
description: We’re writing a new story. We’re adding chapters and characters with every groundbreaking product launch. But our theme never changes: Square is making commerce better for everyone. And our audience is the whole world.

title: Product Designer
description: We celebrate the little details and flourishes that make a software product really shine. We push on the feature set, refine the design and visuals, and partner closely with engineering to ensure that every customer is positively delighted with using Square's software products.

title: Product Communications Manager
description:
We tell stories to help the world understand and connect with Square's purpose and products. Our global communications team is made up of tough, quick-witted, entrepreneurial, and intellectually-curious people.
Square is a design and story-driven company. The Product Communications Manager will help create and drive compelling narratives, campaigns, and announcements that communicate the benefits of buying and selling with Square across all marketing and communication channels.
This position works closely with many teams inside Square, including marketing, design, product, engineering, and support. This role requires flexibility, the ability to change course quickly, the ability to think big and start small, and someone who thrives in high-stress situations.

title: Accountant
description:
The Square Finance team is looking to hire an Accountant.  We continue to need strong accounting talent as our team and company grow.  This role will play an integral part in the day-to-day operations and accounting close with opportunities to work on various projects as we scale.        
 
Responsible for assisting the Accounting Manager with:
Prepare month-end journal entries, balance sheet reconciliations, and supporting schedules
Heavily involved in A/P process – coding and approving invoices and creating POs
Manage corporate credits cards and following up with vendors
Assist with employee expense reimbursements
Assist in monthly close process and ensure entries are in accordance with GAAP
Provide supporting documents for audit
Maintain general ledger system for growth and scale
Assist in implementation of procurement system
Provide management reports and analysis
Interact with Finance and Strategy team on various analysis
Ad hoc analysis and tasks as needed

title: Payments Analyst
description: We are looking for a data analyst to join the Payments team at Square. As a member of our multi-disciplinary team, you will be responsible for improving the company’s ability to use data to inform the development and operations of services. You will have the opportunity to inform decision making and strategy, and to create strong feedback loops through data visualization and analysis. You should be passionate about surfacing insights in data and reporting findings to the company and external parties.

title: Platform Data Analyst
description: As a Platform Data Analyst, your goal is to help us grow efficiently by reconciling every bit of platform data. To accomplish this, you will partner with every project team that affects money movement, understand data structures behind new products and changes, and reconcile them to third party reports or to our bank statements. This will involve mastery of SQL (Postgres/MySQL preferred) and the ability to communicate in technical and business terms. Your work will inform the roadmap on our core reconciliation system, FReD.
